Hi Joe,

I wonder what you mean by "Marking the super-test-class abstract" =
in
your reply. Is my superclass (FirstTest) not already abstract ?

Regards=
,

Al

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...> w=
rote:
>
> Al May wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > Hi,
> > 
> > Is it possible to have a=
 test class without any tests inside its body
> > (e.g. with no @Test annot=
ation inside) ? It's because I've created an
> > abstract class containing =
all my tests and I extend this class for
> > each implementation that I hav=
e to test. By doing this, I don't need
> > to write redundant code to test =
different kind of implementations. To
> > help you better understand, I giv=
e you an example :
> > 
> > public abstract class FirstTest {
> > 
> > @Tes=
t
> > public test1() {
> > // ...
> > IFactory factory =3D getFactory();
> =
> // ...
> > }
> > 
> > @Test
> > public test2() {
> > // ...
> > IFactory =
factory =3D getFactory();
> > // ...
> > }
> > 
> > protected abstract IFac=
tory getFactory();
> > 
> > }
> > 
> > /*
> > * This class should be consid=
ered a test class even there is no
> > * @Test inside. Normally, it inherit=
 all the test methods from
> > * the superclass.
> > *
> > */
> > public cl=
ass Implementation1Test extends FirstTest {
> > 
> > protected IFactory get=
Factory() {
> > return new MyFirstImplementationFactory();
> > }
> > 
> > }=

> > 
> > Now, if I try to run Implementation1Test as a JUnit test, Eclipse=

> > reports me an error. I have to specify at least one @Test annotation
>=
 > in my concrete test class. Is there anybody who can help how to do
that =
?
> 
> I believe this is a known Eclipse problem, so I recommend asking
Ecl=
ipse 
> people, rather than JUnit people. I had the same problem with Eclip=
se 
> running JUnit 3 tests. Marking the super-test-class abstract worked 
=
> around the problem there.
> -- 
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.j=
brains.ca

> JUnit Recipes: Practical=
 Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution A=
gile Software Practice
>
